intro: Phyllochlamys taxoides var. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phyllochlamys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically densely arranged along the stems. The plant produces clusters of white to pale pink flowers, which bloom in late spring or early summer. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. This evergreen shrub thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
